column4: Internal error? Oh, there's an option to submit a report. I'll do that…
Precise is no longer under development. Huh? Oh, there's a convenient “I don't know what to do” option.
Why doesn't it just submit a bug report like OS X does? 6_9
I don't really want to go to a website and follow through a bunch of stuff…
Anyway, I have a few problems here still.
1. display is borked. Not sure how to describe it, but the /entire/ thing looks like the wallpaper in http://cl.ly/IqDo .
2. I'm always typing `Linux nomodeset` at the yaboot prompt, and I'd like to know how to automate that.
3. The system beep in tty's is /really/ loud, and I'd like to turn its volume down.
yaboot is a OS am I right?
ah oh well nomodeset is easy in grub, lol.
yes if the drive has a OS and a bootloader.
yes if the /disc/ in the drive has an OS and a bootloader?
can you explain more what exactly your trying to do.
install Ubuntu from a CD|DVD. The computer in question has a broken internal (optical) disc drive, though, so...
might not have one. We'll check, though.
